node.title: SA records seven new COVID-19 cases and high risk exposure site in North Adelaide
node.description: South Australia has recorded seven new cases of COVID-19 with a North Adelaide bakery named as a 'high risk' exposure site.
node.content:
["South Australia has recorded seven new cases of COVID-19, with a North Adelaide bakery named as a high-risk\u00a0exposure site.", "The cases are four men aged between 20 and 40 and three women aged between 20 and 60.\u00a0", "One of the cases acquired the infection interstate.\u00a0", "Three of the cases acquired their infection locally and are known contacts of previously reported cases, with one contact linked to the Norwood cluster.\u00a0", "According to SA Health, the remaining three cases are linked but the local source of infection is yet to be indentified.\u00a0", "A man in his thirties has been transferred to the Royal Adelaide Hospital and is in a stable condition, bringing the total number of recent COVID-related hospital admissions\u00a0to three.\u00a0", "The 24-hour Bakery on O'Connell in North Adelaide has been listed as a \"high-risk, close contact exposure location\"\u00a0after a positive case visited there late on Tuesday, between 11.20pm and 12.50am Wednesday.\u00a0", "Meanwhile, the Woodville South McDonald's has been listed as a close contact exposure location, on Wednesday between 1.30pm and 2pm, as has\u00a0the No.9 Karaoke Bar in the city, on last Saturday from 9pm to the early hours of Sunday morning.\u00a0", "The Rebel sports store at Gepps Cross, the restaurant Pho Vinh Hoa at Rosewater, and the Golden Grove Central Districts Baseball Club at Surrey Downs have all been listed as casual contact exposure locations.\u00a0", "
Premier defends quarantine changes
", "Earlier today, Premier Steven Marshall defended increasing quarantine requirements for those\u00a0exposed to the Omicron variant, saying it aims to reduce the risk of a wide-spread outbreak before Christmas.\u00a0", "Yesterday it was revealed close contacts of the COVID-19 variant, Omicron \u2014\u00a0or suspected cases \u2014\u00a0will be required to quarantine for 14 days, regardless of their vaccination status, instead of the usual seven days for vaccinated people.\u00a0", "", "
South Australian\u00a0Premier Steven Marshall says he wants to reduce the risk of a big outbreak before Christmas.\u00a0(ABC News: Trent Murphy)
", "Mr Marshall said South Australia\u00a0was adopting the same quarantine protocols for Omicron\u00a0as the ACT and Queensland.\u00a0", "\"At this point in time, we are being cautious.\u00a0We don't want a big Omicron outbreak in South Australia just before Christmas,\" he said.\u00a0", "However, Mr Marshall said, he was hoping the quarantine requirement could soon be reduced back down to seven days.\u00a0", "\"It's a general consensus among\u00a0most of the states to go to 14 days in the early days of Omicron,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We are also looking at all of the close contacts [who]\u00a0have been asked to go into 14 days' [quarantine[.\u00a0We will do more detailed investigation with them and, if we can remove them from the 14 day program, we will.\"\u00a0", "Casual contacts of Omicron cases are still required to get tested immediately and quarantine until they receive a negative test result and get retested on days six and 13.\u00a0", "Mr Marshall responded to concerns that the increased quarantine requirement could result in fewer\u00a0people using QR codes to check-in at places they visit in the lead up to Christmas.\u00a0", "\"While\u00a0there is a lot of fear out there, the reality is that fear has been whipped up by my political opponents \u2014\u00a0the reality is QR check-ins are at record levels in South Australia,\" he said.\u00a0", "The government has removed the restriction for people coming in from New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT\u00a0to have to isolate until they receive a negative test result.\u00a0", "\"This was really slowing down the number of people [who]\u00a0were coming in, especially ahead of the Ashes cricket,\" Mr Marshall said.\u00a0", "", "
A sign outside Olivers Pets and Plants alerting customers of its closure due to a COVID-19 exposure.(ABC News: Rory McLaren)
", "Two of the eight COVID-19\u00a0cases recorded in South Australia\u00a0yesterday are suspected to be the Omicron variant.", "\"We still suspect that the cases identified yesterday were Omicron, based on where these people were coming into South Australia, but we still need to do that final testing, the genome sequencing. That is happening. We probably won't know for another couple of days,\" Mr Marshall said.\u00a0", "One or both of the suspected Omicron cases visited three exposure sites listed yesterday:", "
Hospital staff member tests positive
", "General manager of The Memorial Hospital in North Adelaide,\u00a0Janet Jongeneel, issued a memo on Friday, informing staff that a team member had tested positive to COVID-19.\u00a0", "The staff member worked in an operating theatre on Wednesday afternoon.\u00a0", "On Thursday, they felt unwell, proceeded to get tested and received a positive result Friday mid-morning.\u00a0", "\"Staff and VMOs who have, at this stage, been identified as close contacts, have been instructed to have a PCR test and immediately self-quarantine while\u00a0awaiting further instruction from SA Health,\" Ms Jongeneel said.", "\"In line with the vaccine mandate for healthcare workers in South Australia, all affected staff members and VMOs are fully vaccinated.\"", "The Memorial Hospital has not been listed as an exposure site on the SA Health website.\u00a0", "\"We only provide exposure sites when we haven't been able to contact and put people into quarantine that we need to or if it becomes a transmission site,\" Mr Marshall said.\u00a0", "\"We do that because we don't want to create unnecessary\u00a0fear.\u00a0", "\"Often, it is a very small number of people who could have potentially come into contact with a positive case.\"\u00a0", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
